medium: Ink, colors, and gold leaf on silk
title: Rakan with Whisk (Jivaka)
text: In the Buddhist Hinayana belief (or the “Lesser Vehicle”), the rakan served as the “perfected one” who gained salvation through his own efforts and overcame the endless cycle of birth and rebirth, but was unable to attain full enlightenment like bodhisattvas. The rakan here is holding a fly whisk designed to chase away insects without harming them, following the Buddhist law against taking life.
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
